Row.Text: The sun rises on a new Age. As we enter this brave new world, your civilization must relocate its capital to face the new challenges the Age will bring.
Choose a Civic to begin studying.
Choose a Technology to begin researching.
Select a Technology below to research.
Hide progress toward revealing new Civics
What Civic would you like to study next?
Are you sure you want to change your project?
Select a Civic below to study.
What Culture project would you like to study next?
What Technology would you like to research next?
What Technology project would you like to research next?

+50% Growth. All of the Town's Production is converted into Gold. When the Town grows, it can claim a new Rural tile to add to its territory. This tile comes with the basic Improvement for its Terrain and Features.
All of the Town's Food is converted into Gold. The Town will no longer grow.
All of the Town's Food is sent to the chosen City. The Town will no longer grow.
This Civilian Unit will be created in the City Center.
Each Government gives a set of choices during a Celebration.
{1_turns} {1_turns: plural 1?Turn; other?Turns;} until this Age ends
Can be moved after initial construction at 25% of usual cost
This City currently allows {1_Specialist} {1_Specialist: plural 1?Specialist; other?Specialists;} per Tile
This Town currently allows {1_Specialist} {1_Specialist: plural 1?Specialist; other?Specialists;} per Tile
{1_Turns} {1_Turns: plural 1?turn; other?turns;} until the Settlement is permanently lost
Your Settlement won’t grow due to starvation.
Next Treasure Convoy will spawn in {1_Turns} {1_Turns: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}
{1_TechName} Technology needed to spawn Treasure Convoy
{1_ConstructName} Building needed to spawn Treasure Convoy
Choose what you want to do with this Settlement
This settlement has a custom name. Consider renaming it after you decide what to do with it.
Happiness and Production will be temporarily reduced until the Settlement is assimilated.[n]{1_penalty}.
Remove the Settlement permanently after {1_Turns} {1_Turns: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}. This incurs a -100 Diplomatic Penalty
This Settlement is being razed and will be removed entirely in {1_Turns} {1_Turns: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}
WARNING: This City contains World Wonders that will be permanently lost!
Currently {1_Name}, with pending changes in the production queue
Currently empty location, with pending changes in the production queue
Constructing a {1_constructibleName} on this tile will complete the {2_uniqueQuarterName} Unique Quarter.
Constructing a {1_constructibleName} on this tile will block the completion of the {2_uniqueQuarterName} Unique Quarter in this City.
No Trade Hubs available![N][N]Build a Market building in a City or Town to make it a Trade Hub, then you can send routes to it from any other Settlement within 10 tiles.
Are you sure you want to cancel this Trade Route?
This Settlement is not connected to the Capital via your Trade Network.
You may be able to connect it to an already connected Settlement by building a road with a Merchant, constructing a coastal building, or founding a settlement within range to connect them.
Send your Merchant to a city to trade Resources with
Select a City below to create a Trade Route with
Move the merchant to the target city.
Select a valid merchant unit to start a trade route.
Select a valid trade route to start.
Until the end of this Age
The maximum number of Age Progression points has been reached. This Age will end in 5 Turns! (at standard speed)
This Age is almost over! Only {1_turns} {1_turns: plural 1?turn; other?turns;} left!
You can add a Specialist here.
You CANNOT add a Specialist here.
This tile has {1_NumSlots} specialist {1_NumSlots: plural 1?slot; other?slots;} available.
Select a tile to Place the {1_BuildingName}
Place the {1_Building} here to complete the {2_Quarter}

You can remove and replace with any other Codex

Select {1_NumPantheons} Pantheon {1_NumPantheons: plural 1?belief; other?beliefs;} from below
Another Civilization already worships this Pantheon.
A Pantheon you have chosen has already been taken by another Civilization.

Unlock more Founder beliefs through gameplay
Found a Religion to unlock a Reliquary Belief
This Belief is already held by another Religion.
A Belief you have chosen has already been taken by another Civilization.
This Belief type helps you spread your Religion. You may have only one Enhancer Belief.
Provides bonuses for converting other players' Settlements. More Founder Beliefs can be unlocked through gameplay.
This Belief type provide ways of earning Relics. You may have only one Reliquary belief.
This Government grants you a choice between these effects during a Celebration.
[B]Choose one bonus for the next {1_Turns} {1_Turns: plural 1?Turn; other?Turns;}[/B]
Settle nearby to collect Treasure Resources from Distant Lands
Research Ruins at Universities or Museums
What a country chooses to save is what a country chooses to say about itself.

History is built in layers. As a civilization grows and ages, it inevitably changes. New ideas and technology challenge the core beliefs, goals, and aspirations of your people. It is time to adopt a new identity.

You'll next be asked to select a new Civilization, one whose powers are peaking in the next Age. Choose wisely on behalf of your citizens, then look to the first turn of this new Age as a chance to strategically pivot your renewed empire.
<<Player will be invited to download the next age>>

[N][Icon:NAR_QUEST]Selecting this option will begin a quest
